TopicTitle: Location markers on nav ball not showing

Articles.Content: I can't find or it isn't there how to put waypoints of locations like nerds crater and get it on nav ball.   It makes flyby contract next to impossible do .
the idea of flybys is that u use the map to check your trajectory and adjust it just so that u pass the location marked in the mapscreen
you are able to set these in the PC version and have been since before the ps4 build. So it's bugged ?

3 hours ago, gryste said:

  you are able to set these in the PC version and have been since before the ps4 build. So it's bugged ?

You have to set it active in the PC version from the map, did you do that?

I sometimes have this problem in the PC version.  Mark the location as active in map mode but it doesn't show on the navball...except it does show on the internal view navball (press 'c' on the PC--don't have the PS4 version yet so don't know how on it).

Edit: Just saw in another post you can activate IVA view from the Kerbal portraits.

On 13 July 2016 at 11:38 PM, Alshain said:

You have to set it active in the PC version from the map, did you do that?

 Tried.  But nothing happens, get a big blank square where you would expect the option set waypoint marker.

It's the same on the XBO version, so it maybe a bug (one of many!!!) with the console version(s).

You select the survey target in the map view, and you get a box come up with the targets name in it, and the game grinds to a crawl until you can get rid of the box (which takes numerous presses of B to do)

I am informed that when you click the target in map view on PC you get the option to add the target as a waypoint on your navball.

Yep to all of these, it needs to be put in the bug tracker, if you haven't already.  I've been orienting myself using the compass, switching to the map, getting a rough guess of the angle I need to go on the nav ball and let it fly for a bit.

And they also need to check if there is a memory leak when you do click on one of the nodes, yes it seems like it's supposed allow you to activate the target location, but as stated it slows to a crawl (as it does several times, when moving the mouse around while in orbit/flying and switching between my fuels to contracts to another location), I do wonder what will happen when we get into more sophisticated builds with lots of moving parts.

I'm unaware of a workaround for this. Unfortunately until this is fixed you will need to orientate using the map view and navball. Its tedious but will give you a better understanding of how the navball works. So if you set up a trajectory that looks like it will pass close to the target/mission marker. Then you just have to keep an eye at the top of the screen and it will tell you , you are entering zone xz86 for example. Then just come out of map view and run experiment/ crew report( whatever is required for the contract) hope this helps

also try to get a good plane built for these missions, as it will cost too much(and be a lot harder to do)with rockets, that way you can guarantee a profit from the mission as you can just land and recover vessel/ fly back to ksc to get 100% of the cost of launching the plane.
